Sometimes the inside of a CRT monitor will begin coated with miscroscopic particles which impede the transmission of light. There's a new on line cleaner available for getting rid of this. I recommend you do this every ten years or just buy another monitor.
 
 http://www.cleanscreen.info/

post_info.post_title: New screen cleaner on the market...

Sometimes the inside of a CRT monitor will begin coated with miscroscopic particles which impede the transmission of light. There's a new on line cleaner available for getting rid of this. I recommend you do this every ten years or just buy another monitor.

 I'll send this to a writer friend. He's still using something out of the 1980s, including a 14" monitor the size of a small cabin cruiser. Some writers are very superstitious.

As evidenced by the sickness of the cat, it is not advised to lick the interior of your monitor screen!
